title: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner - Practice Exam (CLF-C01) - 3

domainGradeBreakdown.domainDescription: This represents exam questions for the Cloud Computing section.
This represents exam questions for the Security & Compliance section.
This represents exam questions for the Technology section.
This represents exam questions for the Billing & Pricing section.

questions.questionText: When talking about AWS security, what does "authorization" refer to?

choices.text: Identifying who is accessing the system
choices.explanation: This is considered authentication, not authorization. Authorization determines which services and resources the authenticated identity has access to.
Logging in is allowed once you are authenticated, not authorized.

choices.text: A user delegating access to another user temporarily
choices.explanation: This is not authorization. Authorization determines which services and resources the authenticated identity has access to.

choices.text: Evaluating what permissions a user has
choices.explanation:
Authentication identifies who is accessing the system and passes that information to the authorization process, which in turn determines what permissions the user has in AWS. Although authorization is a part of the process to log in to the Console, by itself it is not enough.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/details/manage-users/
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/introduction.html

correctAnswers.text: Evaluating what permissions a user has
correctAnswers.explanation:
Authentication identifies who is accessing the system and passes that information to the authorization process, which in turn determines what permissions the user has in AWS. Although authorization is a part of the process to log in to the Console, by itself it is not enough.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/details/manage-users/
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/introduction.html

questions.questionText: An organization needs to run a MySQL relational database on AWS. They plan to hire their own database administrators to manage their databases, including taking backups, using replication, and clustering. Which option provides the customer the control and flexibility needed?

choices.text: Use the Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) to launch the MySQL database.
choices.explanation: RDS does provide a lot of value, like automated backups and software patching, but it does not provide the complete control and flexibility needed by the customer.

choices.text: Install the MySQL database directly on an EC2 instance.
choices.explanation: Installing the database directly to EC2 gives the customer complete control over the database and its management.

choices.text: Use Systems Manager to install the MySQL database directly to on-premises servers.
choices.explanation: The database needs to be installed first before Systems Manager can interact with it. Additionally, an on-premises database doesn't meet the requirement of having the database run on AWS.

choices.text: Open a case with AWS Support to have them assist the database administrators with the installation of the MySQL database.
choices.explanation: AWS Support does not allow cases for code development, debugging custom software, or performing system administration tasks.

correctAnswers.text: Install the MySQL database directly on an EC2 instance.
correctAnswers.explanation: Installing the database directly to EC2 gives the customer complete control over the database and its management.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Use the Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) to launch the MySQL database.
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: RDS does provide a lot of value, like automated backups and software patching, but it does not provide the complete control and flexibility needed by the customer.

questions.questionText: A customer needs to identify vulnerabilities on their EC2 instances, such as unintended network access. Which services will provide a report of findings?

choices.explanation: Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.
The IAM credential report lists all the users and the status of their various credentials, including passwords, access keys, server certificates, and MFA devices.
Artifact offers on-demand access to AWS security and compliance reports.
Macie uses machine learning to discover sensitive data stored on Amazon S3.

Trusted Advisor is a tool that provides real-time guidance to help you provision resources following AWS best practices. It will check security groups for rules that allow unrestricted access (0.0.0.0/0) to specific ports.

correctAnswers.explanation: Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.

Trusted Advisor is a tool that provides real-time guidance to help you provision resources following AWS best practices. It will check security groups for rules that allow unrestricted access (0.0.0.0/0) to specific ports.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: The IAM credential report lists all the users and the status of their various credentials, including passwords, access keys, server certificates, and MFA devices.

questions.questionText: Which AWS service provides central governance and management across multiple AWS accounts?

choices.explanation: AWS Organizations is designed specifically for multi-account management (not IAM). IAM allows you to control access to your AWS services and resources.
CloudFormation is not for account management. CloudFormation allows you to provision AWS resources using infrastructure as code (IaC).

AWS Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under one umbrella.
https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/
Systems Manager is not for account management. Systems Manager gives you visibility into and control over your AWS resources.

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under one umbrella.
https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/

questions.questionText: Which service powers the creation of encrypted EBS volumes for Amazon EC2?

choices.explanation: When you create an encrypted Amazon EBS volume, you're able to specify a KMS customer master key.
CloudHSM is a hardware security module (HSM) used to generate encryption keys. It is used for handling encryption keys in AWS, but does not work with EBS Volume Encryption
IAM allows you to control access to your AWS services and resources. This manages your access to resources in AWS, but does not handle the encryption of resources such as EBS volumes.
Secrets Manager allows you to manage and retrieve secrets (passwords or keys). It is used for handling encryption keys in AWS, but does not work with EBS Volume Encryption

correctAnswers.explanation: When you create an encrypted Amazon EBS volume, you're able to specify a KMS customer master key.

questions.questionText: A new application rolled out by the development team is going to require load balancing of HTTP and HTTPS traffic. Which load balancer is best suited for this type of traffic?

choices.explanation: This is not a valid option. The Application Load Balancer is best suited for HTTP traffic.

An Application Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of HTTP and HTTPS traffic and provides advanced request routing targeted at the delivery of modern application architectures, including microservices and containers.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

A Network Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), User Datagram Protocol (UDP), and Transport Layer Security (TLS) traffic where extreme performance is required.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

A Classic Load Balancer provides basic load balancing across multiple Amazon EC2 instances and operates at both the request level and connection level. Classic Load Balancer is intended for applications that were built within the EC2-Classic network.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

correctAnswers.explanation:
An Application Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of HTTP and HTTPS traffic and provides advanced request routing targeted at the delivery of modern application architectures, including microservices and containers.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

questions.questionText: You have an EC2 instance that contains a web application being put into operation. To prepare for the application going live for public use, you add a few more instances in a distributed manner in order to handle an increase in load. Which concept is used to measure a system's ability to grow to accommodate an increase in demand?

choices.explanation: Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.

Scalability means the systems can adapt to meet new levels of demand. There are both horizontal and vertical scaling in regards to compute resources. Horizontal scaling involves the adding of instances of the same size. Vertical scaling is typically a manual process where the size of the instance is changed. AWS Documentation: [Scalability](https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/2020-07-02T19-33-23/wat.concept.scalability.en.html).
Reliability is the ability of a workload to perform its intended function correctly and consistently.

Elasticity describes the ability to acquire resources as you need them and release resources when you no longer need them. In the cloud, you want to do this automatically. Most people, when thinking of cloud computing, think of the ease with which they can procure resources when needed. This is only one aspect to elasticity. The other aspect is to contract when they no longer need resources. Scale out and scale in. Scale up and scale down. AWS Documentation: [Elasticity](https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/2020-07-02T19-33-23/wat.concept.elasticity.en.html).

correctAnswers.explanation: Scalability means the systems can adapt to meet new levels of demand. There are both horizontal and vertical scaling in regards to compute resources. Horizontal scaling involves the adding of instances of the same size. Vertical scaling is typically a manual process where the size of the instance is changed. AWS Documentation: [Scalability](https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/2020-07-02T19-33-23/wat.concept.scalability.en.html).

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Elasticity describes the ability to acquire resources as you need them and release resources when you no longer need them. In the cloud, you want to do this automatically. Most people, when thinking of cloud computing, think of the ease with which they can procure resources when needed. This is only one aspect to elasticity. The other aspect is to contract when they no longer need resources. Scale out and scale in. Scale up and scale down. AWS Documentation: [Elasticity](https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/2020-07-02T19-33-23/wat.concept.elasticity.en.html).

questions.questionText: You need an AWS service that can identify objects, people, text, scenes, and activities in images and videos. Which service would you choose?

choices.explanation: Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.

Amazon CloudSearch is a managed service that makes it easy to add a search solution to your website or application.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudsearch/
CloudWatch is a collection of services that help you monitor and observe your cloud resources.

Rekognition allows you to automate your image and video analysis.
https://aws.amazon.com/rekognition/?blog-cards.sort-by=item.additionalFields.createdDate&blog-cards.sort-order=desc

correctAnswers.explanation:
Rekognition allows you to automate your image and video analysis.
https://aws.amazon.com/rekognition/?blog-cards.sort-by=item.additionalFields.createdDate&blog-cards.sort-order=desc

questions.questionText: A purchasing department staff member is set up as an AWS user in the company’s Procurement AWS account. At each month-end, the staff member needs access to an application running on EC2 in the company’s Accounts Payable AWS account to reconcile reports. Which of the following provides the most secure and operationally efficient way to give the staff member access to the Accounts Payable application?

choices.text: Configure Active Directory integration so you can federate the staff member’s access to the Accounts Payable AWS account.
choices.explanation: Federation will require the use of a role as well, but with the added overhead of maintaining Active Directory.

choices.text: Create a user for the staff member in the Accounts Payable AWS account.
choices.explanation: Setting up another AWS user for the staff member in the Accounts Payable account will require the presentation of hard credentials programmatically.

choices.text: Have the user request temporary security credentials for the application by assuming a role.
choices.explanation:
The staff member should be given the ability to assume a role programmatically with the permissions necessary to run the Accounts Payable application.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_common-scenarios.html

choices.text: Invoke an AWS Lambda function to run the application in the Accounts Payable AWS account.
choices.explanation: Lambda will require the use of a role as well, but with the added overhead of maintaining the Lambda function.

correctAnswers.text: Have the user request temporary security credentials for the application by assuming a role.
correctAnswers.explanation:
The staff member should be given the ability to assume a role programmatically with the permissions necessary to run the Accounts Payable application.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_common-scenarios.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Configure Active Directory integration so you can federate the staff member’s access to the Accounts Payable AWS account.
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Federation will require the use of a role as well, but with the added overhead of maintaining Active Directory.

questions.questionText: You would like to set up a loosely coupled architecture. Which service would allow you to send and receive messages and store them if they are not consumed immediately?

choices.explanation: SES is an email service that allows you to send richly formatted HTML emails from your applications.

DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database.
https://aws.amazon.com/dynamodb/

SQS is a message queuing service that allows you to build loosely coupled systems.
https://aws.amazon.com/sqs/
S3 is an object storage service for the cloud that is highly available.

correctAnswers.explanation:
SQS is a message queuing service that allows you to build loosely coupled systems.
https://aws.amazon.com/sqs/

questions.questionText: A company is trying to visualize and forecast its costs and usage over time. Which service can help them?

choices.explanation: Budgets allows you to set custom budgets that alert you when your costs or usage exceed your budgeted amount.
The Cost and Usage Report contains the most comprehensive set of cost and usage data.
Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella. You can allocate resources and apply policies across accounts.
Cost Explorer allows you to visualize and forecast your costs and usage over time.

correctAnswers.explanation: Cost Explorer allows you to visualize and forecast your costs and usage over time.

questions.questionText: A company with a business-critical application needs to ensure business continuity and that they will not be impacted by capacity restraints in a given Region. How can the company ensure this?

choices.text: Spot instance with a capacity reservation
choices.explanation: While your instance is launched only if capacity is available, Spot doesn't reserve capacity.
On-Demand Capacity Reservations enable you to reserve compute capacity for your Amazon EC2 instances for any duration.

choices.text: Standard Reserved Instance (RI) with a capacity reservation
choices.explanation: A Reserved Instance is a reservation of resources and capacity for either 1 or 3 years. A capacity reservation offers assurance that the customer will be given preference if there is ever a capacity constraint in a Region.

choices.text: Savings Plan with a capacity reservation
choices.explanation: With a Savings Plan, you commit to specific usage, but this commitment doesn't reserve capacity.

choices.text: Convertible Reserved Instance (RI)  with a capacity reservation
choices.explanation: A Reserved Instance is a reservation of resources and capacity for either 1 or 3 years. A capacity reservation offers assurance that the customer will be given preference if there is ever a capacity constraint in a Region.

correctAnswers.explanation: On-Demand Capacity Reservations enable you to reserve compute capacity for your Amazon EC2 instances for any duration.

correctAnswers.text: Standard Reserved Instance (RI) with a capacity reservation
correctAnswers.explanation: A Reserved Instance is a reservation of resources and capacity for either 1 or 3 years. A capacity reservation offers assurance that the customer will be given preference if there is ever a capacity constraint in a Region.

correctAnswers.text: Convertible Reserved Instance (RI)  with a capacity reservation
correctAnswers.explanation: A Reserved Instance is a reservation of resources and capacity for either 1 or 3 years. A capacity reservation offers assurance that the customer will be given preference if there is ever a capacity constraint in a Region.

questions.questionText: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is the customer’s responsibility when using Amazon RDS?

choices.text: Collecting monitoring data to debug failures
choices.explanation: You are responsible for collecting monitoring data from all the parts of your AWS solutions so you can more easily identify issues.
AWS is responsible for this. As a managed service, Amazon RDS is protected by the AWS global network security procedures.

choices.text: Using AWS encryption solutions to protect data
choices.explanation: You are responsible for protecting your data.
You are responsible for managing access to your databases.
You are responsible for managing backups of your data.

correctAnswers.text: Collecting monitoring data to debug failures
correctAnswers.explanation: You are responsible for collecting monitoring data from all the parts of your AWS solutions so you can more easily identify issues.

correctAnswers.text: Using AWS encryption solutions to protect data
correctAnswers.explanation: You are responsible for protecting your data.
You are responsible for managing access to your databases.
You are responsible for managing backups of your data.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are valid EC2 pricing options?

choices.explanation:
On-Demand is where you pay for the resources you have used at the end of the billing period.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/

Reserved is were you commit to paying a certain amount every billing period for a length of time, no matter if you used them or not.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/
This is not a valid EC2 pricing option.
This is not a valid pricing option.

correctAnswers.explanation:
On-Demand is where you pay for the resources you have used at the end of the billing period.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/

Reserved is were you commit to paying a certain amount every billing period for a length of time, no matter if you used them or not.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/

questions.questionText: Which of the following support services do all accounts receive as part of the AWS Support Basic tier?

choices.explanation: This is an element of a paid plan.
This is an element of a paid plan.
This is an element of a paid plan.

The AWS Support Basic tier is the free support given to all AWS accounts. All accounts receive billing support, because every customer needs an avenue to lodge disputes or make requests around their billing.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

correctAnswers.explanation:
The AWS Support Basic tier is the free support given to all AWS accounts. All accounts receive billing support, because every customer needs an avenue to lodge disputes or make requests around their billing.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

questions.questionText: A company has an application with user bases in both Australia and Canada. The company has deployed their application to servers currently provisioned in the Canada (Central) Region. Unfortunately, Australian users are experiencing high latency and slow download times. How can the company reduce latency?

choices.text: Provision resources across Availability Zones in the Canada (Central) Region to handle the demand.
choices.explanation: This does not reduce latency for Australian users.

choices.text: Provision resources to the Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region in Australia.
choices.explanation: A multi-Region deployment solves the issue by deploying the application closest to the user base.

choices.text: Use S3 Transfer Acceleration to speed up delivery of static content to users in Australia.
choices.explanation: S3 Transfer Acceleration improves content uploads and downloads to and from S3 buckets.

choices.text: Set up Direct Connect for users in Australia.
choices.explanation: Direct Connect is a dedicated physical network connection from your on-premises data center to AWS.

correctAnswers.text: Provision resources to the Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region in Australia.
correctAnswers.explanation: A multi-Region deployment solves the issue by deploying the application closest to the user base.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Use S3 Transfer Acceleration to speed up delivery of static content to users in Australia.
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: S3 Transfer Acceleration improves content uploads and downloads to and from S3 buckets.

questions.questionText: For a subnet to be public and send non-local traffic to the internet, we must update the route table of the public subnet and attach which of the following to the VPC that contains the subnet?

choices.explanation: Routers define how network traffic is routed.
Route 53 is a DNS service that routes users to applications.

An internet gateway enables resources inside your VPC to reach the internet, as long as route tables and IP addresses are correctly configured in your environment.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonVPC/latest/UserGuide/VPC_Internet_Gateway.html
NACLs ensure proper traffic is allowed in the subnet.

correctAnswers.explanation:
An internet gateway enables resources inside your VPC to reach the internet, as long as route tables and IP addresses are correctly configured in your environment.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonVPC/latest/UserGuide/VPC_Internet_Gateway.html

questions.questionText: What are the ways a user can access resources in their AWS account?

choices.explanation: The AWS CLI allows you to access your AWS account through a terminal or command window.
Application code is a form of programmatic access. Programmatic access provides access to your AWS resources through an application or a tool like the CLI.
The AWS Management Console allows you to access your AWS account and manage applications running in your account from a web browser.
API Gateway is used by developers to create APIs.

correctAnswers.explanation: The AWS CLI allows you to access your AWS account through a terminal or command window.
Application code is a form of programmatic access. Programmatic access provides access to your AWS resources through an application or a tool like the CLI.
The AWS Management Console allows you to access your AWS account and manage applications running in your account from a web browser.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is an AWS global service?

choices.explanation: RDS is a regional service.
EC2 is a regional service.

Amazon CloudFront is a fast content delivery network (CDN) service that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to customers globally with low latency and high transfer speeds, all within a developer-friendly environment.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/
VPC is a regional service.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Amazon CloudFront is a fast content delivery network (CDN) service that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to customers globally with low latency and high transfer speeds, all within a developer-friendly environment.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/

questions.questionText: Your company has decided to migrate entirely to the AWS Cloud. Which answers are a part of the 6 advantages of cloud computing?

choices.text: Stop spending money running and maintaining data centers.
choices.explanation:
Focus on projects that differentiate your business, not the infrastructure. Cloud computing lets you focus on your own customers rather than on the heavy lifting of racking, stacking, and powering servers.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

choices.text: Benefit from minor economies of scale.
choices.explanation:
By using cloud computing, you can achieve a lower variable cost than you can get on your own. Because usage from hundreds of thousands of customers is aggregated in the cloud, AWS can achieve higher economies of scale, which translates into lower pay-as-you-go prices.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

Easily deploy your application in multiple regions around the world with just a few clicks. This means you can provide lower latency and a better experience for your customers at a minimal cost.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

choices.text: Trade variable expense for capital expense.
choices.explanation:
Instead of having to invest heavily in data centers and servers before you know how you’re going to use them, you can instead wait and pay only when you consume computing resources and pay only for how much you consume.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

correctAnswers.text: Stop spending money running and maintaining data centers.
correctAnswers.explanation:
Focus on projects that differentiate your business, not the infrastructure. Cloud computing lets you focus on your own customers rather than on the heavy lifting of racking, stacking, and powering servers.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

Easily deploy your application in multiple regions around the world with just a few clicks. This means you can provide lower latency and a better experience for your customers at a minimal cost.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

questions.questionText: The load on your application fluctuates by day of the week. Wednesdays have the most traffic, and Saturdays have the least traffic. Which AWS service allows you to ensure you have the correct amount of compute capacity while also optimizing on a cost basis?

choices.explanation: CloudWatch is a collection of services that help you monitor and observe your cloud resources.
Trusted Advisor provides real-time guidance to help you provision your resources following AWS best practices.
Control Tower helps you ensure your accounts conform to company-wide policies.

Auto Scaling allows you to add or remove EC2 instances based on conditions you specify. Auto Scaling events can be scheduled to meet predictable changes in the load on your application.
https://aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Auto Scaling allows you to add or remove EC2 instances based on conditions you specify. Auto Scaling events can be scheduled to meet predictable changes in the load on your application.
https://aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: CloudWatch is a collection of services that help you monitor and observe your cloud resources.

questions.questionText: When talking about AWS security, what does "authentication" refer to?

choices.explanation: You will have to identify who you are before logging in.

choices.text: Identifying who is accessing the system
choices.explanation:
Authentication identifies who is accessing the system and passes that information to the authorization process, which in turn determines what permissions the user has in AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/details/manage-users/
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/introduction.html

choices.text: Evaluating what permissions a user has
choices.explanation: Evaluating permissions is considered authorization, not authenication.

choices.text: A user delegating access to another user temporarily
choices.explanation: This is not the act of authenticating yourself.

correctAnswers.text: Identifying who is accessing the system
correctAnswers.explanation:
Authentication identifies who is accessing the system and passes that information to the authorization process, which in turn determines what permissions the user has in AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/details/manage-users/
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/introduction.html

questions.questionText: Which credentials can you use to access the AWS Management Console?

choices.explanation: Access keys are long-term credentials and are used for programmatic access.
Access keys are long-term credentials and are used for programmatic access.
Security tokens are temporary, limited-privilege credentials and aren't used to access the Console.

You use a username and password to log in to the AWS Console, although access keys and secret access keys can be used to access some APIs programmatically.
https://aws.amazon.com/console/

correctAnswers.explanation:
You use a username and password to log in to the AWS Console, although access keys and secret access keys can be used to access some APIs programmatically.
https://aws.amazon.com/console/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Access keys are long-term credentials and are used for programmatic access.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is an AWS global service?

choices.explanation: RDS is a regional service.
EC2 is a regional service.
VPC is a regional service.
Identity and Access Management is a global service.

correctAnswers.explanation: Identity and Access Management is a global service.

questions.questionText: A company is launching a new product and needs help with assessing its operational readiness and identifying and mitigating risks. Which feature of the Enterprise Support plan provides this?

choices.explanation: Professional Services helps enterprise customers move to a cloud-based operating model.
Infrastructure Event Management provides support for planning and running business-critical events.

choices.text: Technology partner from the AWS Partner Network (APN)
choices.explanation: Technology partners provide software solutions.
Managed Services helps you efficiently operate your AWS infrastructure and reduces operational risks and overhead.

correctAnswers.explanation: Infrastructure Event Management provides support for planning and running business-critical events.

questions.questionText: What defines long-term data protection?

choices.explanation: Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.
The cloud gives you increased agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.

Highly available systems are designed to operate continuously without failure for a long time.
These systems avoid loss of service by reducing or managing failures.

With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of
time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.

correctAnswers.explanation: Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.

questions.questionText: A company has developed a popular online multiplayer gaming application. How can the company enhance its players' online experience and improve overall application availability and reduce in-game latency?

choices.explanation: While CloudFront can improve the global availability of static and dynamic content, CloudFront caches content and isn't the best option for real-time gameplay.
Route 53 is a DNS service that routes users to applications. DNS stands for Domain Name System and directs internet traffic by connecting domain names with web servers.
CloudTrail tracks user activity and API calls within your account.

Global Accelerator can improve the experience by routing player traffic along with the private AWS global network to the fastest instance of your application. Player traffic is not negatively impacted by internet congestion and local outages.

correctAnswers.explanation: Global Accelerator can improve the experience by routing player traffic along with the private AWS global network to the fastest instance of your application. Player traffic is not negatively impacted by internet congestion and local outages.

questions.questionText: Which AWS design principle can be a valuable feature when deploying applications?

choices.explanation: AWS focuses mostly on virtual appliances.
Coupling defines the interdependencies or connections between components of a system. Loose coupling helps reduce the risk of cascading failures between components.
Although applications can run across regions, it is not a specific design principle of AWS.
This is not an AWS best practice and is actually counter to the AWS best practice of loose coupling.

correctAnswers.explanation: Coupling defines the interdependencies or connections between components of a system. Loose coupling helps reduce the risk of cascading failures between components.

questions.questionText: A colleague tells you about a service that uses machine learning to discover and protect sensitive data stored in S3 buckets. Which AWS service does this?

choices.explanation:
Rekognition allows you to automate your image and video analysis.
https://aws.amazon.com/rekognition/?blog-cards.sort-by=item.additionalFields.createdDate&blog-cards.sort-order=desc

Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.
https://aws.amazon.com/inspector/

Macie helps you discover and protect sensitive data.
https://aws.amazon.com/macie/

SageMaker helps you build, train, and deploy machine learning models quickly.
https://aws.amazon.com/cognito/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Macie helps you discover and protect sensitive data.
https://aws.amazon.com/macie/

questions.questionText: An oil and gas utility company which is highly regulated must create a Cloud governance scheme. The company is organized into multiple autonomous departments which will all be using AWS resources. These departments each sponsor independent projects that are reviewed by regulatory boards for the approval of customer price increases. The code and infrastructure for each project has production, development, and testing environments. Which of the following account strategies will maximize security and operational efficiency for the company?

choices.text: Create a single AWS account for centralized security management.
choices.explanation: This is not a best practice. AWS Organizations works best for this scenario, as it allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella.

choices.text: Create multiple AWS accounts: 1 for the production environment, 1 for the development environment, and 1 for the testing environment for all departments.
choices.explanation: This is not a best practice. AWS Organizations works best for this scenario, as it allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella and implement service control policies (SCPs) for the entire organization in one place.

choices.text: Create an Organizational Unit structure in AWS Organizations with separate underlying accounts for production, development, and testing environments.
choices.explanation:
A multi-layered account structure will work best for this company, leveraging AWS Organizations to establish Organizational Units for each department, with separate production, development, and testing environments. While there is no physical AWS account at the department level, service control policies can be applied at the Organizational Unit level, and billing can be reported separately for each department. An account for each department — in which the department combines dev/test/prod — or a single account for the company hosting all workloads together will NOT provide segregation of production, development, and testing environments at the account level. Multiple standalone accounts for each department and environment would compromise operational efficiency in managing environments across departments, as there is no overarching AWS Organization to manage all the accounts centrally.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/security-pillar/wellarchitected-security-pillar.pdf
https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/

choices.text: Create multiple AWS accounts, 1 for each autonomous department within the company.
choices.explanation: This is not a best practice. AWS Organizations works best for this scenario, as it allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella.

correctAnswers.text: Create an Organizational Unit structure in AWS Organizations with separate underlying accounts for production, development, and testing environments.
correctAnswers.explanation:
A multi-layered account structure will work best for this company, leveraging AWS Organizations to establish Organizational Units for each department, with separate production, development, and testing environments. While there is no physical AWS account at the department level, service control policies can be applied at the Organizational Unit level, and billing can be reported separately for each department. An account for each department — in which the department combines dev/test/prod — or a single account for the company hosting all workloads together will NOT provide segregation of production, development, and testing environments at the account level. Multiple standalone accounts for each department and environment would compromise operational efficiency in managing environments across departments, as there is no overarching AWS Organization to manage all the accounts centrally.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/security-pillar/wellarchitected-security-pillar.pdf
https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/

questions.questionText: A college student wants to quickly launch a WordPress website but doesn't have a lot of cloud experience. Which service will help the student launch the website with a low, predictable monthly fee?

choices.explanation: Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers.
Outposts allows you to run cloud services in your internal data center.
Lightsail allows you to quickly launch all the resources you need for small projects like preconfigured applications like WordPress.
An EC2 instance is not the best choice for someone who has no cloud experience.

correctAnswers.explanation: Lightsail allows you to quickly launch all the resources you need for small projects like preconfigured applications like WordPress.

questions.questionText: Which of the following EC2 instance types will realize a savings over time in exchange for a contracted term-of-service?

choices.explanation: There is no such thing as Discount Instances.
On-Demand Instances are charged equally per-hour, regardless of how long they're run for.
EC2 Reserved Instances offer significant discounts for a contracted term-of-service, up to 75% off.
Spot Instances are cheaper than On-Demand Instances, but aren't intended for long term use.

correctAnswers.explanation: EC2 Reserved Instances offer significant discounts for a contracted term-of-service, up to 75% off.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are focuses of the operational excellence pillar of the Well-Architected Framework?

choices.explanation:
This is a focus of the operational excellence pillar. This pillar focuses on creating applications that effectively support
production workloads.

This is a focus of the operational excellence pillar. This pillar focuses on creating applications that effectively support
production workloads.

choices.text: Ignore failure and don't introduce changes.
choices.explanation: This is not a focus of the operational excellence pillar. In this case, you should learn from your failures and refine your approach.

This is a focus of the operational excellence pillar. This pillar focuses on creating applications that effectively support
production workloads.

correctAnswers.explanation:
This is a focus of the operational excellence pillar. This pillar focuses on creating applications that effectively support
production workloads.

This is a focus of the operational excellence pillar. This pillar focuses on creating applications that effectively support
production workloads.

This is a focus of the operational excellence pillar. This pillar focuses on creating applications that effectively support
production workloads.

questions.questionText: What AWS service lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud?

choices.explanation: RDS (Relational Database Service) enables the creation and management of relational databases in AWS.

Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud. You have complete control over your virtual networking environment, including the selection of your own IP address range, creation of subnets, and configuration of route tables and network gateways. You can use both IPv4 and IPv6 in your VPC for secure and easy access to resources and applications.
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable cloud Domain Name System (DNS) web service. It is designed to give developers and businesses an extremely reliable and cost-effective way to route end users to internet applications by translating names — like *www.example.com* — into the numeric IP addresses — like 192.0.2.1 — that computers use to connect to each other. Amazon Route 53 is fully compliant with IPv6 as well.
https://aws.amazon.com/route53/

An elastic network interface is a logical networking component in a VPC that represents a virtual network card. It can include multiple attributes, such as security groups, IPv6 and IPv4 addresses, MAC addresses, and more.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-eni.html

correctAnswers.explanation:
Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud. You have complete control over your virtual networking environment, including the selection of your own IP address range, creation of subnets, and configuration of route tables and network gateways. You can use both IPv4 and IPv6 in your VPC for secure and easy access to resources and applications.
https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a design principle of the Well-Architected Framework's reliability pillar?

choices.explanation: This not a focus of the reliability pillar. Instead, you should scale horizontally (i.e., scale out) for resilience.
This is a focus of the reliability pillar. This pillar focuses on designing systems that work consistently and recover quickly.
This is a focus of the sustainability pillar, not the reliability pillar.
This is not a focus of the reliability pillar. Instead, you should test recovery procedures.

correctAnswers.explanation: This is a focus of the reliability pillar. This pillar focuses on designing systems that work consistently and recover quickly.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is AWS' data warehousing service?

choices.explanation: EMR helps you process large amounts of data.
Snowball is a physical appliance used to transfer data into or out of AWS.

Redshift is AWS' data warehousing service.
[https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/mgmt/welcome.html
While S3 can hold large amounts of data, it is not a data warehouse solution.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Redshift is AWS' data warehousing service.
[https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/mgmt/welcome.html

questions.questionText: A company is considering the cloud deployment models when planning a new application. Which deployment model allows the company to fully stop spending money running and maintaining data centers?

choices.explanation: With the hybrid cloud, some resources run in the cloud while others run on-premises. This means resources run in the AWS cloud and your internal data center.
With the public cloud, all resources run in the cloud.  Don't forget: This is the AWS Cloud.
With the private cloud, all resources run on-premises. Don't forget: This is your internal data center.
IaaS is not considered a cloud deployment model.

correctAnswers.explanation: With the public cloud, all resources run in the cloud.  Don't forget: This is the AWS Cloud.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: IaaS is not considered a cloud deployment model.

questions.questionText: Which policy will provide information on performing penetration testing on your EC2 instances?

choices.explanation: Most IAM policies are stored in AWS as JSON documents. There is no relation to penetration testing on EC2 instances.
IAM policies define permissions to AWS resources, but they have nothing to do with penetration testing on EC2 instances.

The AWS Customer Agreement contains the terms and conditions that govern your access to and use of the AWS service offerings and is an agreement between the applicable AWS contracting party and you or the entity you represent. It is not specific about penetration testing on EC2 instances.

choices.text: Customer Service Policy for Penetration Testing
choices.explanation: AWS customers are welcome to carry out security assessments or penetration tests against their AWS infrastructure without prior approval for Amazon EC2 instances, NAT gateways, elastic load balancers, and 7 other services. Reference: [Penetration Testing](https://aws.amazon.com/security/penetration-testing/).

correctAnswers.text: Customer Service Policy for Penetration Testing
correctAnswers.explanation: AWS customers are welcome to carry out security assessments or penetration tests against their AWS infrastructure without prior approval for Amazon EC2 instances, NAT gateways, elastic load balancers, and 7 other services. Reference: [Penetration Testing](https://aws.amazon.com/security/penetration-testing/).

questions.questionText: Under the shared responsibility model, for which of the following does AWS NOT assume responsibility?

choices.explanation: AWS controls access to its data centers where your data resides.
AWS maintains networking components: generators, uninterruptible power supply (UPS) systems, computer room air conditioning (CRAC) units, fire suppression systems, and more.

Customers are responsible for their own customer data in the cloud. AWS manages the networking, hypervisor configuration, and physical security.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/
AWS maintains the physical hardware, including software to help them manage virtualization.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Customers are responsible for their own customer data in the cloud. AWS manages the networking, hypervisor configuration, and physical security.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

questions.questionText: Using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) is related to which cloud concept?

choices.explanation: Infrastructure as Code is a key implementation of automation in cloud - using Infrastructure as Code allows you to quickly and easily deploy and manage your environment without reliance on humans to complete all the tasks.
Scalability is the concept that, as cloud has essentially limitless capacity, it allows you to expand out as needed.
With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand based on workload changes.
High availability is the concept that your services in the cloud should be designed to tolerate failures in the underlying cloud infrastructure.

correctAnswers.explanation: Infrastructure as Code is a key implementation of automation in cloud - using Infrastructure as Code allows you to quickly and easily deploy and manage your environment without reliance on humans to complete all the tasks.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: High availability is the concept that your services in the cloud should be designed to tolerate failures in the underlying cloud infrastructure.

questions.questionText: Your company utilizes DNS and wants to migrate DNS and management of DNS to the cloud. Which AWS service would you use?

choices.explanation:
Route 53 is a DNS service that routes users to applications.
https://aws.amazon.com/route53/

CloudFormation allows you to provision AWS resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/
An Application Load Balancer directs traffic to EC2 instances and balances the load between them.

CloudFront is a CDN that delivers data and applications globally with low latency.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Route 53 is a DNS service that routes users to applications.
https://aws.amazon.com/route53/

questions.questionText: What can we do in AWS to receive the benefits of volume pricing for your multiple AWS accounts?

choices.text: You will receive volume pricing by default.
choices.explanation: This is not a default benefit provided by AWS.

choices.text: Use consolidated billing in AWS Organizations.
choices.explanation: You can use the consolidated billing feature in AWS Organizations to consolidate billing and payment for multiple AWS accounts or multiple Amazon Internet Services Pvt. Ltd (AISPL) accounts. You can combine the usage across all accounts in the organization to share the volume pricing discounts, Reserved Instance discounts, and Savings Plans. This can result in a lower charge for your project, department, or company than with individual standalone accounts.
Trusted Advisor can provide recommendations on cost, but it will not provide any volume discounts.

choices.text: Purchase services in bulk from AWS Marketplace.
choices.explanation: AWS Marketplace can provide some discounts on services, but it is not specifically designed to provide a volume discount with your AWS accounts.

correctAnswers.text: Use consolidated billing in AWS Organizations.
correctAnswers.explanation: You can use the consolidated billing feature in AWS Organizations to consolidate billing and payment for multiple AWS accounts or multiple Amazon Internet Services Pvt. Ltd (AISPL) accounts. You can combine the usage across all accounts in the organization to share the volume pricing discounts, Reserved Instance discounts, and Savings Plans. This can result in a lower charge for your project, department, or company than with individual standalone accounts.

questions.questionText: Why would you use tags in AWS?

choices.explanation: Tags consist of a key-value pair and aren't used to store data.
Tags consist of a key-value pair and aren't used to store code.

A tag is a label that you or AWS assigns to an AWS resource. You can use tags to organize your resources, and cost allocation tags to track your AWS costs on a detailed level.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/cost-alloc-tags.html

choices.text: To store passwords for your servers
choices.explanation: Tags consist of a key-value pair and shouldn't be used to store sensitive information.

correctAnswers.explanation:
A tag is a label that you or AWS assigns to an AWS resource. You can use tags to organize your resources, and cost allocation tags to track your AWS costs on a detailed level.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/cost-alloc-tags.html

questions.questionText: Your team needs to begin monitoring the applications running in your AWS account by collecting metrics, logs, and events. Which AWS service can you use?

choices.explanation:
CloudWatch is a collection of services that help you monitor and observe your cloud resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/
This is not an AWS service.

Config allows you to assess, audit, and evaluate the configurations of your resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/config/#:~:text=AWS%20Config%20is%20a%20service,recorded%20configurations%20against%20desired%20configurations.

CloudTrail tracks user activity and API calls within your account.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/

correctAnswers.explanation:
CloudWatch is a collection of services that help you monitor and observe your cloud resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/

questions.questionText: Which of the following AWS services can help you assess the fault tolerance of your AWS environment?

choices.explanation: Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.
Shield is a managed Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection service.
WAF helps protect your web applications against common web attacks.

AWS Trusted Advisor can help you assess the fault tolerance of your AWS environment. AWS Inspector can help you assess your security.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/trustedadvisor/

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS Trusted Advisor can help you assess the fault tolerance of your AWS environment. AWS Inspector can help you assess your security.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/trustedadvisor/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are characteristics of Regions?

choices.explanation: Regions are designed to be fully independent and isolated.

choices.text: They are fully independent and isolated.
choices.explanation: Regions are fully independent and isolated. If one Region is impacted, the others will not be.

choices.text: They contain only the resources and services specifically deployed to them.
choices.explanation: Regions are isolated, and resources that are uploaded are not automatically replicated across them.

choices.text: They are grouped in geographic locations.
choices.explanation: AWS logically groups its Regions into geographic locations.

correctAnswers.text: They are fully independent and isolated.
correctAnswers.explanation: Regions are fully independent and isolated. If one Region is impacted, the others will not be.

correctAnswers.text: They contain only the resources and services specifically deployed to them.
correctAnswers.explanation: Regions are isolated, and resources that are uploaded are not automatically replicated across them.

correctAnswers.text: They are grouped in geographic locations.
correctAnswers.explanation: AWS logically groups its Regions into geographic locations.

questions.questionText: A company is planning for a one-time sale of 75% off all products on its website. They expect to see a short-term spike on the sale day. Which EC2 instance type should the company use to meet its requirements and maximize flexibility?

choices.explanation: An RI isn't the best choice since the company has limited flexibility and would be locked into a 1- or 3-year term.
Since the application running on an EC2 Spot Instance can be randomly interrupted, EC2 Spot is not the best choice.
An RI isn't the best choice since the company has limited flexibility and would be locked into a 1- or 3-year term.
On-Demand is good for applications that have unpredictable workloads that can't be interrupted.

correctAnswers.explanation: On-Demand is good for applications that have unpredictable workloads that can't be interrupted.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: An RI isn't the best choice since the company has limited flexibility and would be locked into a 1- or 3-year term.

questions.questionText: Your company is migrating its services to the AWS Cloud. The DevOps team has heard about Infrastructure as Code and wants to investigate this concept. Which AWS service would they investigate?

choices.explanation:
AWS CloudFormation is a service that helps you model and set up your Amazon Web Services resources so you can spend less time managing those resources and more time focusing on your applications that run in AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/

AWS CodeCommit is a fully managed source control service that hosts secure Git-based repositories. It makes it easy for teams to collaborate on code in a secure and highly scalable ecosystem. CodeCommit eliminates the need to operate your own source control system or worry about scaling its infrastructure. You can use CodeCommit to securely store anything from source code to binaries, and it works seamlessly with your existing Git tools. This is not what you are investigating.
https://aws.amazon.com/codecommit/

AWS Elastic Beanstalk is an easy-to-use service for deploying and scaling web applications and services developed with Java, .NET, PHP, Node.js, Python, Ruby, Go, and Docker on familiar servers such as Apache, Nginx, Passenger, and IIS. This is not what you are investigating.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk/

AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You pay only for the compute time you consume. This is not what you are investigating.
https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS CloudFormation is a service that helps you model and set up your Amazon Web Services resources so you can spend less time managing those resources and more time focusing on your applications that run in AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/

questions.questionText: A user is looking to buy a prebuilt solution that runs on AWS that allows them to track projects. Where can the user go to find a catalog of AWS-recognized providers selling third-party solutions to individuals?

choices.explanation: AWS Community Forums allow all community members to freely exchange lessons learned and knowledge; however, this is not the best place to find an AWS-recognized provider.
Managed Services helps you efficiently operate your AWS infrastructure and reduces operational risks and overhead.
Marketplace is a digital catalog of prebuilt solutions you can purchase or license. You may also sell your own solutions to others via Marketplace.

choices.text: Consulting partner from the AWS Partner Network (APN)
choices.explanation: Consulting partners offer professional services.

correctAnswers.explanation: Marketplace is a digital catalog of prebuilt solutions you can purchase or license. You may also sell your own solutions to others via Marketplace.

questions.questionText: With which AWS service, coupled with EC2, can you implement elasticity by adding and removing instances as needed?

choices.explanation: Systems Manager gives you visibility into and control over your AWS resources.
Elastic Beanstalk allows you to deploy your web applications and web services to AWS.
Auto Scaling monitors your applications and automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance.
CloudFormation allows you to provision AWS resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).

correctAnswers.explanation: Auto Scaling monitors your applications and automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance.

questions.questionText: A company needs a scalable data warehouse to consolidate multiple data sources for reporting, where real-time transaction processing (insert, update, and delete) is not required. Which solution best supports this requirement?

choices.explanation: RDS is a service that makes it easy to launch and manage relational databases and is typically used for transactional systems, not reporting and analytics.
Data Pipeline helps you move data between compute and storage services running either on AWS or on-premises.
EMR helps you process large amounts of data.

Redshift is a scalable data warehouse solution that supports querying, reporting, analytics, and business intelligence. It can be used when you need to consolidate multiple data sources for reporting and don't require real-time transaction processing (insert, update, and delete).

correctAnswers.explanation: Redshift is a scalable data warehouse solution that supports querying, reporting, analytics, and business intelligence. It can be used when you need to consolidate multiple data sources for reporting and don't require real-time transaction processing (insert, update, and delete).

questions.questionText: A company has provisioned an EC2 instance as a web server. The web application on the server is running within a subnet within a VPC. For some reason, the application is unable to access the internet. Which component is missing?

choices.explanation: An internet gateway allows public traffic to the internet from the VPC.
VPC peering allows you to connect 2 VPCs together. Peering facilitates the transfer of data in a secure manner.

choices.text: Private IP address for the instance
choices.explanation: Every EC2 instance has a private IP address that belongs to the VPC and subnet in which it was launched, but that doesn't define the application's ability to reach the internet.
NACLs ensure the proper traffic is allowed into the subnet.

correctAnswers.explanation: An internet gateway allows public traffic to the internet from the VPC.

questions.questionText: Which statement is true regarding the AWS Global Infrastructure?

choices.text: Each AWS Region consists of multiple, isolated, and physically separate AZs within a geographic area.
choices.explanation:
AWS has the concept of a Region, which is a physical location around the world where we cluster data centers. We call each group of logical data centers an Availability Zone. Each AWS Region consists of multiple, isolated, and physically separate AZs within a geographic area. Unlike other cloud providers, that often define a region as a single data center, the multiple-AZ design of every AWS Region offers advantages for customers. Each AZ has independent power, cooling, and physical security and is connected via redundant, ultra-low-latency networks. AWS customers focused on high availability can design their applications to run in multiple AZs to achieve even greater fault tolerance. AWS infrastructure Regions meet the highest levels of security, compliance, and data protection.

Reference: [Regions](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/#Regions)
Edge locations are contained within regions.

choices.text: Each AWS Availability Zone contains multiple Regions.
choices.explanation: The reverse is true: Regions contain Availability Zones.
Availability Zones are a set of data centers that host all your needs. Edge locations are small data centers that host web (static and dynamic) contents.

correctAnswers.text: Each AWS Region consists of multiple, isolated, and physically separate AZs within a geographic area.
correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS has the concept of a Region, which is a physical location around the world where we cluster data centers. We call each group of logical data centers an Availability Zone. Each AWS Region consists of multiple, isolated, and physically separate AZs within a geographic area. Unlike other cloud providers, that often define a region as a single data center, the multiple-AZ design of every AWS Region offers advantages for customers. Each AZ has independent power, cooling, and physical security and is connected via redundant, ultra-low-latency networks. AWS customers focused on high availability can design their applications to run in multiple AZs to achieve even greater fault tolerance. AWS infrastructure Regions meet the highest levels of security, compliance, and data protection.

Reference: [Regions](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/#Regions)

questions.questionText: A system administrator works for a company and manages several AWS accounts. He would like to use a Convertible Reserved Instance (RI) across different AWS accounts. How can this be set up?

choices.text: By using combined billing within AWS Budgets
choices.explanation: Budgets allows you to set custom budgets that alert you when your costs or usage exceed your budgeted amount.

choices.text: By using consolidated billing with AWS Organizations
choices.explanation: Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella. You can allocate resources and apply policies across accounts.
Cost Explorer allows you to visualize and forecast your costs and usage over time.

choices.text: By using a service control policy (SCP) under Control Tower
choices.explanation: SCPs use the\_AWS Identity and Access Management\_(IAM) policy language; however, they do not grant permissions, only restrict them.

correctAnswers.text: By using consolidated billing with AWS Organizations
correctAnswers.explanation: Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella. You can allocate resources and apply policies across accounts.

questions.questionText: When analyzing application performance, a developer realizes the queries to the database are taking a long time. What can the developer implement to store common queries and improve performance?

choices.explanation: ElastiCache helps you alleviate database load for data that is accessed often. ElastiCache is a great way to cache common queries.
SQS is a message queuing service that allows you to build loosely coupled systems.
CloudFront speeds up distributions of static or dynamic web content to users.
EBS is a storage device (called a volume) that can be attached to (or removed from) your instance.

correctAnswers.explanation: ElastiCache helps you alleviate database load for data that is accessed often. ElastiCache is a great way to cache common queries.

questions.questionText: A customer has decided to go with a 1-year Standard Reserved Instance (RI) for EC2 since their application has steady state and predictable usage. Which pricing option should they choose to earn the largest discount over the 1-year term?

choices.explanation: On-demand prices are the highest. That's why the customer decided to go with a Standard Reserved Instance (RI).
All upfront earns the maximum discount.
While a partial upfront payment saves more money than no upfront payment, it is not the best choice.
No upfront payment does not offer the largest discount.

correctAnswers.explanation: All upfront earns the maximum discount.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are geographic areas that host 2 or more Availability Zones?

choices.explanation: There is no such thing as a compute zone.

A Region is a geographic area that hosts 2 or more Availability Zones.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/
An origin is the location where content is stored, and from which CloudFront gets content to serve to viewers.
An edge location is used to cache static content.

correctAnswers.explanation:
A Region is a geographic area that hosts 2 or more Availability Zones.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

questions.questionText: You are concerned about access to your top-secret application by stolen passwords. What additional layer of security can you add for logging in to the AWS Management Console, in addition to user passwords?

choices.explanation: Access keys and secret access keys are not used to access the AWS Management Console.

AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of security on top of your username and password.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/features/mfa/

Amazon Transcribe is an automatic speech recognition (ASR) service that converts speech to text.
https://aws.amazon.com/transcribe/
This is not an AWS service.

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of security on top of your username and password.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/features/mfa/

questions.questionText: Which of the following is correct regarding the number of Regions, Availability Zones, edge locations, and data centers?

choices.text: There are more Regions than Availability Zones.
choices.explanation: There are actually more AZs than Regions since Regions can contain multiple AZs.

choices.text: The number of Availability Zones is the same as the number of Regions.
choices.explanation: There are more AZs than Regions.

choices.text: There are more Availability Zones than edge locations.
choices.explanation: There are more edge locations than Availability Zones.

choices.text: There are more Availability Zones than Regions.
choices.explanation:
Regions contain 2 or more Availability Zones, which are themselves made up of 1 or more data centers. This means there will always be more AZs than Regions. Edge locations are separate from AZs and Regions, and there are more Edge Locations than Regions and Availability Zones.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/?p=ngi&loc=2

correctAnswers.text: There are more Availability Zones than Regions.
correctAnswers.explanation:
Regions contain 2 or more Availability Zones, which are themselves made up of 1 or more data centers. This means there will always be more AZs than Regions. Edge locations are separate from AZs and Regions, and there are more Edge Locations than Regions and Availability Zones.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/?p=ngi&loc=2

questions.questionText: A customer is managing multiple AWS accounts using AWS Organizations. What can the customer use to restrict the same permissions across all AWS accounts managed under AWS Organizations using minimal effort?

choices.explanation:
While IAM policies can be attached to individual users, this requires
a lot of effort and is not the easiest way to control access when using AWS Organizations.
There is no such thing as an IAM organization policy.

AWS Organizations provides central governance and management for multiple accounts.
Organization service control policies (SCPs) allow you to create permissions guardrails that apply to all accounts within a given organization.
An S3 bucket policy doesn't apply in this case, as this kind of policy is attached directly to an S3 bucket to control access.

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS Organizations provides central governance and management for multiple accounts.
Organization service control policies (SCPs) allow you to create permissions guardrails that apply to all accounts within a given organization.

questions.questionText: A customer has set up an Amazon S3 bucket and wants to limit access to specific users. What is the most efficient way to do so?

choices.explanation:
You can add a bucket access policy directly to an Amazon
S3 bucket to grant IAM users access permissions for the bucket and the objects in it.

choices.text: IAM role assumed by the user
choices.explanation: While roles can control S3 access, this is not the most efficient way to achieve this.
While you can control access to a bucket with user policies, this is not the most efficient way to achieve this.
This policy gives full access to S3 and is not what the customer is trying to do.

correctAnswers.explanation:
You can add a bucket access policy directly to an Amazon
S3 bucket to grant IAM users access permissions for the bucket and the objects in it.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: IAM role assumed by the user
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: While roles can control S3 access, this is not the most efficient way to achieve this.

questions.questionText: You have a web application that needs to run for a short period of time. It is all right if there are interruptions in the application. Which EC2 instance type would be best for this use case?

choices.explanation:
With On-Demand Instances, you pay for compute capacity by the second with no long-term commitments. This is, however, not the best option for this scenario.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-on-demand-instances.html

Reserved Instances allows you to reserve capacity by committing to a specific instance type in a particular Region for 1 or 3 years.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-reserved-instances.html

Dedicated Instances are Amazon EC2 instances that run on hardware that's dedicated to a single customer.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/dedicated-instance.html

Spot Instances are a great choice for this use case. Amazon EC2 Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity in the AWS Cloud. Spot Instances are available at up to a 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices.
The key phrase in this question is, "It is alright if there are interruptions in the application." If the application could not accept interruptions, then the best option would be On-Demand.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Spot Instances are a great choice for this use case. Amazon EC2 Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity in the AWS Cloud. Spot Instances are available at up to a 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices.
The key phrase in this question is, "It is alright if there are interruptions in the application." If the application could not accept interruptions, then the best option would be On-Demand.

questions.questionText: Your company has decided to migrate a SQL Server database to a newly created AWS account. Which service can be used to migrate the database?

choices.explanation: DynamoDB is a NoSQL database and is not related to SQL Server.
You would be migrating on-premises databases to RDS, but RDS cannot perform the migration itself.

ElastiCache is a fully managed in-memory datastore compatible with Redis or Memcached.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticache/

DMS helps you migrate databases to or within AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/dms/

correctAnswers.explanation:
DMS helps you migrate databases to or within AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/dms/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: You would be migrating on-premises databases to RDS, but RDS cannot perform the migration itself.

questions.questionText: A developer would like to build a serverless application but doesn't want to install files or configure their local development machine. Which service will allow the developer to build the application by writing code in a web browser?

choices.explanation: Cloud9 allows application developers to write code within an integrated development environment (IDE) from within their web browser.
CloudFront is a CDN that delivers data and applications globally with low latency.
CodePipeline automates the software release process.
CodeDeploy manages the deployment of code to compute services in the cloud or on-premises.

correctAnswers.explanation: Cloud9 allows application developers to write code within an integrated development environment (IDE) from within their web browser.

questions.questionText: Which type of user is created when you initially sign up for an AWS account?

choices.explanation: The root user is created when you initially sign up for your account.
A full access user is not created when you open your account.
This user is not created when you open your account. You should create an administrator user using the root user.
A limited access user is not created when you open your account.

correctAnswers.explanation: The root user is created when you initially sign up for your account.
